skills.name: Recognise graphical representations of direct proportion in the form y = kx
Recognise graphical representations of inverse proportion in the form y = k/x
Interpret linear sections of real life graphs
Interpret the gradient on a linear section on a real life graph

explanations.A: The positive sloping section of the graph shows us that the depth is increasing over time. If the sun came out would you expect to see this?
explanations.B: The positive sloping section of the graph shows us that the depth is increasing over time. If it stopped raining would you expect the depth of water in the bucket to increase?
explanations.C: The positive sloping section of the graph shows us that the depth is increasing over time. We would expect this to happen if it started raining.
explanations.D: The positive sloping section of the graph shows us that the depth is increasing over time. If John emptied the bucket would you expect the depth of water in the bucket to increase?

explanations.A: Section Y shows us that the height is increasing over time. Would this happen once the sunflower has reached its maximum height?
explanations.B: Section Y shows us that the height is increasing over time. As it is a straight line it is increasing at a constant (steady) rate.
explanations.C: Not quite, we would expect to see a curve if the rate of growth increased as the gradient would be getting steeper. What might a straight line represent?
explanations.D: Not quite. To show the sunflower shrinking in size, we would have a negative slope, rather than a positive slope as the height would be decreasing over time.

explanations.B: Almost! You've correctly recognised that the gradient represents acceleration, but you also need to consider the impact the direction of the slope has on your answer

explanations.C: Not quite! The time on the graph is represented by the x axis. Think about what the gradient represents.
explanations.D: Not quite! The gradient represents acceleration on a speed-time graph, but this is a distance-time graph. What does the gradient represent on a distance-time graph?

explanations.A: Not quite. Look carefully at what is happening when the number of dollars is 0. If we exchanged $0 would we expect to get some euros?
explanations.B: Not quite. This graph has a negative gradient, which means the more dollars we exchange the less euros we would get. Is this what happens when you exchange currency?
explanations.C: Not quite. This graph is downward sloping, which means the more dollars we exchange the less euros we would get. Is this what happens when you exchange currency?
explanations.D: Converting between dollars and euros is an example of direct proportion. For every dollar you exchange you get the same amount of euros and for $0 you would get â‚¬0. Therefore we are looking for a graph that goes through (0,0) and has a constant positive gradient (upward sloping straight line). Therefore, the graph shown in D would be the most likely graph.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember, for direct proportion if y = 0 then x = 0.
explanations.B: Not quite. This graph has a negative gradient which means as x increases y decreases. For direct proportion as x increases y should also increase.
explanations.C: The graph of two variables that are directly proportional is a straight line with a positive gradient that goes through (0,0) as in option C
explanations.D: Not quite. This graph is downward sloping which means as x increases y decreases. For direct proportion, as x increases y should also increase.

explanations.A: This graph shows that as the number of people working on it increase, as does the time taken. Would more people working on a job mean it takes more or less time?
explanations.B: This graph crosses the axes, which means there must be a point where the number of people = 0 or the time taken = 0. Is this possible when completing a job?
explanations.C: As the number of people working on the job increases, the time taken to complete it decreases, but neither would reach zero on either axis because it would be impossible to complete the job with either 0 people or in 0 time.
explanations.D: This graph shows that as the number of people working on it increases so does the time taken. Would more people working on a job mean it takes more or less time?

explanations.A: This graph shows that as x increases, y also increases. For two variables to be inversely proportional, one must increase as the other decreases. Which graph represents this?
explanations.B: This graph is a parabola, which is the shape of a quadratic curve. For two variables to be inversely proportional, one must increase as the other decreases. Which graph represents this?
explanations.C: This graph shows that as x increases, y also increases. This is direct proportion. For two variables to be inversely proportional, one must increase as the other decreases. Which graph represents this?
explanations.D: For two variables to be inversely proportional, one must increase in proportion as the other decreases. This graph shows that as y decreases, x increases, representing inverse proportion.
